pullRequest.body:
## feat : add definition of `coeff`, `single`, `one` and `sum`

In this PR, we introduce the notions of `coeff`, `single`, `one` and `sum` for skew monoid algebras.

## Context
This is the second part of a planned series of PRs aiming to formalise skew monoid algebras.
The PRs are split to ease the review process. The moral sum of these planned PRs is #10541 and the first part was #15878.

After this PR, the goal will then be to finally define a skewed convolution product on `SkewMonoidAlgebra k G`. Here, the product of two elements `f g : SkewMonoidAlgebra k G` is the finitely supported function whose value at `a` is the sum of `f x * (x â€¢ g y)` over all pairs `x, y` such that `x * y = a`.
(See #10541 at line 558 for an implementation.)

Co-authored-by: MarÃ­a InÃ©s de Frutos FernÃ¡ndez <[mariaines.dff@gmail.com](mailto:mariaines.dff@gmail.com)>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: messageFile.md
messageFile.md
messageFile.md

> Thanks, LGTM!
> 
> However I'm puzzled by this comment:
> 
> > The associativity of the skewed multiplication depends on the `[MulSemiringAction G k]` instance.
> > In particular, this means that unlike in `Mathlib.Algebra.MonoidAlgebra.Basic`, `G` will
> > need to be a monoid for most of our uses.
> 
> because for MonoidAlgebra it's also the case that associativity depends on `G` being a ~monoid~. (Actually, a semigroup suffices; is this what you worry about? If we introduce a "SemigroupSemiringAction" (see [Zulip discussion](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/two-sided.20ideals/near/482454265) for nonunital actions) we could then restore the generality.) Since this PR doesn't actually define the multiplication, maybe remove this paragraph? By the way, have you considered redefining MonoidAlgebra using SkewMonoidAlgebra with the trivial action of G on k (sending every element of k to itself)?

Indeed the comment does not make sense for this PR, I have removed it.

As for your other comment, `MonoidAlgebra` is currently being refactored by other people. I do not know, however, if the plan is to use `SkewMonoidAlgebra`. For now, the objective is only to have a `SkewMonoidAlgebra` on Mathlib.

> Indeed the comment does not make sense for this PR, I have removed it.

Please remove it from the [commit message](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19084#issue-2661920480) too, and merge master to get rid of the `messageFile.md`. Thanks!

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13238472608/job/36948368563)

Thanks, LGTM!

However I'm puzzled by this comment:
> The associativity of the skewed multiplication depends on the `[MulSemiringAction G k]` instance.
In particular, this means that unlike in `Mathlib.Algebra.MonoidAlgebra.Basic`, `G` will
need to be a monoid for most of our uses.

because for MonoidAlgebra it's also the case that associativity depends on `G` being a ~~monoid~~. (Actually, a semigroup suffices; is this what you worry about? If we introduce a "SemigroupSemiringAction" (see [Zulip discussion](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/two-sided.20ideals/near/482454265) for nonunital actions) we could then restore the generality.) Since this PR doesn't actually define the multiplication, maybe remove this paragraph?
By the way, have you considered redefining MonoidAlgebra using SkewMonoidAlgebra with the trivial action of G on k (sending every element of k to itself)?

Thanks, LGTM!

However I'm puzzled by this comment:
> The associativity of the skewed multiplication depends on the `[MulSemiringAction G k]` instance.
In particular, this means that unlike in `Mathlib.Algebra.MonoidAlgebra.Basic`, `G` will
need to be a monoid for most of our uses.

because for MonoidAlgebra it's also the case that associativity depends on `G` being a ~~monoid~~. (Actually, a semigroup suffices; is this what you worry about? If we introduce a "SemigroupSemiringAction" (see [Zulip discussion](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/two-sided.20ideals/near/482454265) for nonunital actions) we could then restore the generality.) Since this PR doesn't actually define the multiplication, maybe remove this paragraph?
By the way, have you considered redefining MonoidAlgebra using SkewMonoidAlgebra with the trivial action of G on k (sending every element of k to itself)?

```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem toFinsupp_apply (f : SkewMonoidAlgebra k G) (g) : f.toFinsupp g = f.coeff g := rfl
```
since `coeff` is the preferred spelling when working with `SkewMonoidAlgebra`

I think I'd slightly prefer the statement
```suggestion
theorem coeff_single (a : G) (b : k) [DecidableEq G] :
    coeff (single a b) = Pi.single a b := by
```
since there are lots of lemmas about `Pi.single`.

The lemma follows [`Finsupp.single_apply`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Finsupp/Defs.html#Finsupp.single_apply) and [`MonoidAlgebra.single_apply`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/MonoidAlgebra/Defs.html#MonoidAlgebra.single_apply). `Finsupp` also has [`Finsupp.single_eq_pi_single`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Finsupp/Defs.html#Finsupp.single_eq_pi_single), maybe it should just be added instead of replacing `coeff_single`?
Why not call Xavier's version `coeff_single_apply` and let `coeff_single` be Eric's version?

```suggestion
    {a : S} [Nonempty G] : IsSMulRegular k a â†” IsSMulRegular (SkewMonoidAlgebra k G) a := by
```
then use `inhabit G` below and replace `Classical.choice inst` with `default`.

```suggestion
instance instOne : One (SkewMonoidAlgebra k G) := âŸ¨single 1 1âŸ©
```

```suggestion
theorem toFinsupp_eq_single_one_one_iff {a : SkewMonoidAlgebra k G} :
```
I think `f.toFinsupp.sum g` would be a more convenient definition. You can leave `sum_def` as currently written.
Do we have these two versions for `Finsupp`? I think we should be consistent here.
Should the two sides be swapped?

I have renamed the lemma to `sum_def` as it is indeed more fitting.
Thanks!

I think you can feel free to omit the type annotations:
```suggestion
    (sum f g).toFinsupp = Finsupp.sum f.toFinsupp (fun a b â†¦ (g a b).toFinsupp) :=
```
I might actually write `(toFinsupp <| g Â· Â·)`.

```suggestion
    (âŸ¨Finsupp.sum f gâŸ© : SkewMonoidAlgebra k' G') = sum âŸ¨fâŸ© (âŸ¨g Â· Â·âŸ©) := by
```
(untested)

Please use `â†¦` in new code added to mathlib (also below). You are using `â†¦` earlier in the file; maybe here you copied some old code and forgot to change it?
```suggestion
    (p.sum fun n x â†¦ f n x + g n x) = p.sum f + p.sum g := Finsupp.sum_add
```

I think it's more idiomatic to use subscripts:
```suggestion
theorem sum_congr {f : SkewMonoidAlgebra k G} {M : Type*} [AddCommMonoid M] {gâ‚ gâ‚‚ : G â†’ k â†’ M}
```

A module doc should not be talking about what is happening in "this PR". This text is what will be displayed in the API docs [here](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/SkewMonoidAlgebra/Basic.html#Skew-monoid-algebras), and "this PR" is meaningless in that context. Take a look at the community's [conventions on module docs](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/doc.html#header-comment) to see what this part of your file should look like. There should at least be a `Main definitions` section by now, covering your new definition. I personally would also like to see a description of what is going on this file which is readable by a mathematician who doesn't know anything at all about Lean (who therefore does not know what "skewed version of `Mathlib.Algebra.MonoidAlgebra.Basic`" means or what `Finsupp` means). 

Here's a module doc I wrote recently: https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Algebra/Module/ModuleTopology.html#A-module-topology-for-modules-over-a-topological-ring . Note that for a long time I completely avoid any Lean-specific language.

Thank you for your comment.

I have updated the header.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(SkewMonoidAlgebra): `coeff`, `single`, `one` and `sum`
